V-Pra Park is one of the beautiful places in Kannur district to spend with your family and children. You drive through roads touching the river powered by solar lights on 2 sides and finally you will start walking on the path built on top of the river. name: Sargaalaya
about: Sargaalaya, the Kerala Arts & Crafts village in Kerala is an initiative by the Department of Tourism, Government of Kerala. The Village is a craft cluster that was conceptualized as a tourism destination, developed and implemented on the Responsible Tourism model. It is an initiative to put Kerala's traditional handicrafts on the tourism trail. Sargaalaya focuses on creating a tourist destination,

name: Biyyam Kayal Backwater
about: It is an excellent lake with great scenic views and still more interesting, can be accessed from both south and north by the Kanoli canal. Unfortunately the Tourism department is unaware of its potential and hence no active promotion as tourist destination. Tourists reach there by chance rather than by design or planning. There can be boating facility across Kanoli canal with Biyyam as an interim halt which should attract tourists in hoards. Such lakes are rare in Northern Kerala and hence still more importance to be accorded. Persoanlly, I had been there first in professional capacity when I 'discovered' the lake after which I go there once in a while. It is easy to cultivate friendship with local boat men who can be ready to help when you reach there on advance communication. Of course, citizensof Ponnani are the most friendly type in South Western part of the peninsula.

name: Bharathapuzha River
about: Originating from Anamalai hills Bharathapuzha flows along three districts with several tributaries joining ends up in the sea near Ponnani. It is also called Nila and has many cultural significance like "Mamangam" the age old festival during the Chera dynasty which was conducted on the banks of the river once in every twelve years from 14th century to 18th century, the "Kerala Kalamandalam" a center for Indian performing arts which is in Cheruthuruthy on the banks of the river and above all the birth place of several renowned poets and writers of Kerala like Kunchan Nambiar, M.T. Vasudevan Nambiar, O.V. Vijayan, V.K.N., M. Sukumaran etc... Bharathapuzha has become the part of the life of people of Malabar, the entire cultivation is dependent on the water of the river. We can take bath, swim etc in several places named "Kadavu" and during rainy season the river overflows in many places and may be bit dangerous.

name: Central Forest Nursery
about: It was a cold rainy day but worth yhe trip up the range to this lovely little oasis of a native nursery in the fabulous town of Maleny on Sunshine coast hinterland. We were suprised and delighted to find a well organised and extensive range of well labeled plants and some we had been chasing for our property. They have garden and sustainabiluty gifts and even a bookstore section so picked up a textbook we needed also. they sell boomerang bags and even nest boxes of many varieties. Have an impressive loyaty card system if you are driving through the area semi regularly or almost local it would be worth signing up. Helpful friendly staff who left us to browse with no pressure and assisted as required.

name: Thunchan
about: Thunjan parambu is a place about two km from Tirur town in Malappuram District of Kerala. This is the birth place of Thunjathu Ramanujan Ezhuthachan Father of present day Malayalam Language. In latter part of his life he lived in Chittur in Palakkad District. He is known for translating epics like Ramayana, Mahabharatha etc.. This place is presently managed by a trust. There is a museum, open air auditorium, library, cottages, dormitories etc. There is no entry fee at this place. But there is entrance fee for museum, Photography even using mobile phone is charged. Week long  thunjan festival is conducted every year.

name: Ponnani Juma Masjid (Makkah of Kerala Muslims)
about: The six century old Ponnani Juma Masjid which is believed to have built by Zainuddin Makdoom I, the desendent of an Arab Theologian who visited Ponnani became a learning center of Islam. The famous book "Tuhfatul Mujahideen" about the historical account of Malabar was written by Zainuddin Makdoom II staying in this mosque. The Masjid was constructed in Keral style Architecture mainly using wood and the tomb of the Hindu carpenter who later converted to Islam and named Ashari Thangal and Zainuddin Makdoom I is in the Masjid compound.  A lamp used by Zainuddin Makdoom II and an ancient sword are still in the masjid. The Masjid is still in perfect condition and the annual festival (Nercha) is during the month of March/April.

name: Kumaragiri Farm & Nature Camp
about: Farmkamp Kumaragiri estates is a family held rubber plantation in Kerala.Visitors can enjoy the beauty of Kerala by staying in this plantation itself since travelling in Kerala during the monsoon is a terrible experience.The estates are open to visitors only during Monsoon months starting June till December.The visitors can enjoy kerala cuisine and the greenery of hills by staying in this 1500 acre farm. There is small forest stretch within the plantation and the night treks are worth experiencing. Coconuts and other spices are also grown along with coffee and cardamom on top of the hills going up to 1200 feet above msl. A visitor to the camp can use the natural pool and experience the agricultural practices and just relax in luxury of nature.A trip to UNESCO heritage labelled spot- Silent Valley is an added attraction for visiting the Farmkamp at Kumaragiri Estates. Other interesting areas for visiting around the Farmkamp is the Nilambur forest division.

name: Thirunavaya Sree Nava Mukunda Temple
about: Even though Kuttippuram is the nearest railway station for express trains ( Thirunavaya Station is there but only passenger trains stop), for my train from Chennai, I had to get down at Thirur station, the next nearest station. It's 10 km from Thirur railway station. Limited non AC Accomodation is available at Temple with prior tele booking. Temple is an ancient sacred beautiful Vishnu temple on the banks of Bharatapuzha river. Devotees come here for performing rites to ancestor's in family. You need to take token at the temple opens at 5 am.  Parking spaces are available. Nearby restaurants are limited but available.

name: Kerala Museum
about: We are a group of 4 people and we visited on 22 / 01 / 2023 . It was not as what we had expected . There are 3 different places to see over here namely : dolls museum , art gallery and light and sound show . The art gallery and the doll musuem were terrible as we knew what indian cities are there and what type of cloth do the citizens wear in what city  , but the light and sound show was excellent.  The entrance fee is 100 rupees per person as a foreigner what i had paid and there is no any extra charge for the camera or photos . It is very far from the area of city centre of and it is located in the area of eravukalam .Yes it is woth if you are visiting the LULU MALL then you can visit this .  Don't recommend visiting this if there are a lot of other places to visit in kochi city centre as :  fort kochi , vpeen Island or do boating at marine drive .

about: We are providing Taxi service from Kochi to Various destinations of customer choice with brand new vehicles and well experienced drivers. Ranging from 3 pax to 49 pax carrier we have an array of vehicles that operates for tourist packages, corporate travelling, special events, Outstation and local transfers

name: Chinese Fishing Nets
about: Interesting to walk by and enjoy if you're in the area.  The whole area is filled with tourists and sellers of all kinds of wares.  Some you can walk out on and watch/photograph for a small fee, which is variable and expected.  They are very close to many hotels and restaurants so it's easy to include on a leisurely walk in the area.

name: David Hall Gallery & Cafe
about: David Hall is a beautiful old Dutch bungalow that has been restored and has taken on a new life as a cultural centre with a gallery for contemporary art, with a focus on providing a platform for young artists. With its cafÃ© serving authentic thin crust pizzas, delicious bites and beverages; and a space for performing arts, the historic building could be an inspiring, vibrant meeting place for fresh talent and lovers of art.

name: Santa Cruz Cathedral Basilica
about: Santa Cruz Cathedral Basilica was built by the Portuguese in Fort Cochin, one of the oldest Christian / Catholic Churches in India, which is owned and administered by the Diocese of Cochin, open to all, when no religious and liturgical services are in progress. Most welcome to all, who love history and Gothic Architectural attractions in the City of Cochin, Kerala.

name: Mattancherry Palace
about: A good palace with paintings, remains of  kings life. It also has lot of historical details written and ordered well. Each room in the palace is constructed with lot of designs and architecture. A good place which is well maintained by ASI.

name: Paradesi Synagogue
about: The structure itself is not huge but the synagogue is beautiful. The tiles inside the main hall are all hand painted by Chinese artisans. The place has a long history which is really interesting to read about and see for yourself. The chandeliers are as specially impressive. There is something very peaceful about the place.

name: Jew Town
about: Jew Town is definitely one of the best places to visit in Kochi. The history of the place speaks to you through the streets and the buildings alike. The wide range of artefacts for sale in the shops here is something to look forward to. I wish we had known earlier about how many things I would be tempted to buy from here. The best part is that almost all the shops will also arrange for shipping the items to your place at nominal charges.

name: Kerala Folklore Museum
about: Folklore Museum aims to provide art education to the students and helping to provide visual and academic knowledge to the art lovers, researchers and travelers from all over the world. Folklore museum is the only architectural museum in Kerala and the treasure trove of stone, wood and bronze sculptures, ancient terracotta, stone Age objects, jewellery, paintings, oil lamps, musical instruments, tribal and folk art, wood works, utensils, masks and traditional art forms etc. these are around 4000 artifacts from tiny to large size on display. This ethnic museum is the essence of the life and culture of the common man over the past 1000 years.

name: LuLu Mall
about: The best mall in Kerala, where you have everything under one roof. Food court was excellent with very reasonable prices. Next to it you have a large play area with lots of options to have fun. Only problem is finding a parking spot especially during weekend.

name: Wonderla Kochi
about: Wonderla Holidays Limited, is the No. 1 amusement park operator in India. Promoted by Arun K. Chittilappilly and Kochouseph Chittilappilly, Wonderla currently owns and operates three amusement parks â€“ one each in Kochi, Bangalore and Hyderabad respectively and a resort in Bangalore. Wonderla Kochi, spread over 35 acres of land, is thrilling visitors with 56 rides since 2000. Wonderla Bangalore, spanning over 82 acres, offers a spectacular range of entertainment with 61 rides. Wonderla Hyderabad, the latest edition in the portfolio, is spread over 50 acres and offers 43 attractions. Wonderla Amusement Park has been ranked No. 1 in India and No. 6 in Asia by TripAdvisor for 4 consecutive years. Wonderla Resort, located beside the amusement park in Bangalore, comprises of 84 luxury rooms, with amenities including 4 full-fledged banquet halls, multi cuisine restaurant, rest-o-bar and recreational facilities like a heated swimming pool, kidâ€™s activity centre & a full fledged gym.

name: Hindustan Spices and Herbals
about: AboutThere is a simple remedy for the heat and humidity of the plains of Kerala: a trip to the mountains where at the edge of the Periyar Tiger Reserve, the Hindustan Spices is located. At a distance of 10 KM from Thekkady wild life sanctuary, where the air is relatively cool, carm, quite & pollution freeâ€¦. If you want to get some depth information on kerala's medicinal plants and spices you visit our garden and get a first hand information on all spices and herbals.From the very encient period kerala especially Idukki was popular for its natural beauty and spicy air.Here we introduce various medicinal plants and spices for the people of different parts of India and abroad. Kerala is popularly known as "God's Own Country" and Idukki is known as "Heaven of all spices". Hindustan Spices and herbals trying to make the availability of all spices and herbals of god's own country. Kerala was known for its spices and traders travelled here to trade and to gain control over this rich land.Read moreMeets animal welfare guidelinesSuggest edits to improve what we show.Improve this listing

name: Mango Meadows Agricultural Theme Park
about: AboutThe worldâ€™s 1st Agricultural theme park and resort, spread across 30 acres of land with more than 4500 species of plants and trees, Enjoy and relax in one of the worldâ€™s richest bio diversity park. Experience ultimate relaxation in the lap of nature, surrounded by trees, wind, open paddy fields, and mystic magical places or natureâ€™s own hot spots. Refresh your mind and body and even boost your memory with time in abundance. An ideal place to set your kids free to do what ever they want until they get tired. A place were all the modern amenities and goodness of mother earth meets. If you feel its time to breath some real fresh air then you can always come back for more. We are 100% isolated from all sort of pollution.Read moreDuration: More than 3 hoursMeets animal welfare guidelinesSuggest edits to improve what we show.Improve this listing

name: Discs & Machines - Sunny's Gramophone Museum
about: AboutA collection of more than 100 000 gramophone Records of various materials like shellac, vinyl, paper, alumunium; cylinder records, wire records, Various types of tape records, Laser Disc,CD, various types of Floppy discs , films etc in the Records Archive. The history of recording sound from the experiments of Edward Leon Scott in the 1850s to the present day is show cased. In between this, visitors will meet Charles Cross who first put forth the idea of recording and reproduction of sound, Thomas Alva Edison who recorded and reproduced sound for the first time, Charles Sumner Tainter who pioneered in the commercial production of recording machine and Emile Berliner who invented Gramophone Record and the most successful material for making good quality records. In the Museum, there are more than 260 gramophones, record players, Phonographs, wire recorders,tape recorders, laser players, early period sewing machines and musical instruments. Additional attractions are antique items, vintage cars and bikes and the art works of the owner in wood and cement concrete.Read moreDuration: 2-3 hoursSuggest edits to improve what we show.Improve this listing

name: Wonderwerk Kitchen
about: AboutWe envision a world in which people of all races, ethnicities, and religions can live in harmony with one another. We think it's a great idea to start by eating together, since we ended up getting separated while looking for food! At our place, we introduce you to authentic Kerala cuisine, and we are eager to learn about the traditions and cuisine in your place too!Read more

name: Chavara Bhavan Shrine
about: By Geoff Hâ€œIf you want peacefulness and serenity...â€Nov 2018There are two things to remember about the Chavara Bhavan Shrine; one - you can only get to it by boat and, two, if you want action, then this is not the place for you.  However, if you want peacefulness and serenity then this spiritual resort is a "must see" attraction.  The highlight of the shrine is Kuriakose's preserved home, a rather small hut.  It has a thatched roof of coconut leaves and a simple living space, which indicate his simple life.  Just drink in the quiet surroundings and, if you want to, offer up a small prayer.  Refreshments are available on site.

name: Sea View Park
about: By Joji Jâ€œ"Park by seaside"â€Nov 2019The Sea View Park is to the end of the beach which is the only area with some tree shade. The park has ornamental plants, facilities for kids activity and a proper maintenance will bring more people in the evenings. Parking is available in front and on holiday evenings the area will be full of vehicles. Last week when we went to the park there were several students group and it seems the school excursion period has started. There are food stalls in the area and the park is a nice place to spend an evening if its not raining.

name: Sea View Park
about: By Joji Jâ€œ"Park by seaside"â€Nov 2019The Sea View Park is to the end of the beach which is the only area with some tree shade. The park has ornamental plants, facilities for kids activity and a proper maintenance will bring more people in the evenings. Parking is available in front and on holiday evenings the area will be full of vehicles. Last week when we went to the park there were several students group and it seems the school excursion period has started. There are food stalls in the area and the park is a nice place to spend an evening if its not raining.

name: Kuttikattu Sree Bhadra Kali Devi Temple
about: â€œKuttikattu Sree Bhadra Kali Devi Templeâ€Apr 2018Kuttikattu Sree Bhadra Kali Devi Temple is nice place locatd in chertela nice place and even peacefull

name: Chammanad Devi Temple
about: By sikhilâ€œChammanad Devi Templeâ€Apr 2018Chammanad Devi Temple is a famous temple in cherthala ,alappuzha . very spiritual place , atmosphere around is very peaceful ...

name: Thiruvanvandoor Pambanaiappan Temple
about: By Vipin Aroraâ€œVery nice â€Oct 2018One of the 108 divyadesams dedicated to Lord Vishnu ,legend has it ,that this temple was built by Nakula ,one of the five Pandavas . It lies in Chengannur and is built in Kerala style architecture . Since situated near Pamba river , the deity is called Pambianappan . Quite ambient and peaceful place .

name: Kakkathuruthu Island
about: By Joji Jâ€œ"beauty of this small island is beyond explanation"â€Aug 2019The Kakkathuruthu Island in Vembanad Lake, Alleppey is accessible by boat and the beauty of the Island is beyond explanation. The coconut trees, paddy fields, toddy tapping, fish farming, fishing, coir making, having food with fresh catch from the backwaters...there are numerous aspects which make Kakkathuruthu special. We have visited the island several times to watch sunset and when its not raining, watching the sunset is just awesome. You will get good fresh tapped toddy and traditional Kerala food like Appam, puttu, Karimeen roast, crab roast, shrimp fry, chicken, duck, pork dishes and though the side dishes are bit spicy, it is really tasty. Visiting Kakkathuruthu is a must for nature lovers and bird watchers too.

name: Andhakaranazhi Beach
about: By VNJaroorâ€œNice Beachâ€Jan 2022Nice location. Beach with light house. Parking spaces available. Restaurants are available. Some what neat & clean. Kites are available for purchase.

name: Kayamkulam Lake
about: â€œFresh Water Lakeâ€Oct 2018It is worth of each and every minute you spend here as the atmosphere around the lake is pleasant. Watching the water dance on the movement of air is really a joy.

name: Revi Karunakaran Museum
about: â€œBeautiful couple of hours, enchantingâ€Feb 2020An amazing private collection of ivory, porcelain and Swarovski Crystal.

name: St. Mary's Forane Church
about: â€œPeaceful!â€Mar 2022Located in a place called Puliancunnoo. About 25 kms away from Alleppey town. The road that leads to the church is calming. The church has a peaceful atmosphere with the backwaters close by.

name: St. Andrew's Basilica Arthunkal
about: By Frinsonâ€œHistoric pilgrimage centreâ€Feb 2021We visited Arthunkal Basilica on the way back from kumarakom vacation. It's an historic pilgrimage centre and one of the oldest churches in India. The main church and the one built in 1561 are both well maintained and open for public to pray. A must visit if you are in this area and definitely one to explore if you have an interest in Christian history in India

name: St. Andrew's Basilica Arthunkal

name: Ambalapuzha Sree Krishna Temple
about: By Rajang1212â€œGodly experienceâ€May 2023Sree Krishna Temple in Kerala, what can I say about this place, it is just amazing place. A person who is not from kerala will instantly feel the devotional presence the moment you are in the temple. A very large complex, with main deity looks a bit similar to Guvayur Krishna. The paalapayasam is simply the best.

name: St.George Orthodox Church (Chandanapally Valiyapalli )
about: AboutChandanapally literally means the abode of sandalwood trees. The church is named after St. George (also the patron saint of England), who slew the dragon snake.As a village which once had snakes of myriad shapes and venom crawling all over, its residents reposed their faith in the saint to save them from not just snakes but ghosts, demons and other dangers that lurked in the darkness.Read moreDuration: 1-2 hoursSuggest edits to improve what we show.Improve this listing

name: Jatayuppara Sree Kodanda Rama Temple
about: AboutJatayuppara, situated in Kollam dist., Kerala, is the holy hill where the noble bird Jatayu fought a valiant battle against the demon king Ravana. Now, it is home to the world's biggest sculpture of Jatayu & a temple of Lord Shri Ram is being rebuilt after reconsecrated in the '70s, by Swargeeya Swami Sathyananda Saraswathy. A grand International Sree Rama Cultural Complex is also proposed.Read moreDuration: 1-2 hoursSuggest edits to improve what we show.Improve this listing

name: Mall of Travancore
about: The Mall of Travancore, a first-of-its-kind venture by Malabar Group introduces a complete mall experience to the capital city of Kerala. Mall of Travancore is the first and foremost Mall in Trivandrum,situated at NH 66,located right in front of the Trivandrum International Airport. Spread across 7 acres and a built up area of 6.75 lakh Sqft, the mall houses more than 300 brands across 150 stores. There are 7 Screen multiplex , 25000 Sft Hypermareket,15000 Sqft Kids Entertainment area,9D theatre, 10+ fashion anchors spread across 1 lakh Sqft, 25+ F&B Options and 150+ Retail Stores. An open area of 50 000 sq ft is designed for outdoor entertainment.

name: Puthenmalika (Kuthiramalika) Palace
about: The palace museum displays exquisite wood carvings, paintings and various royal collections.
